original: gzhog 'phyas byed na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //

analyzed: slob dpon dang mkhan po dag gis kyang rang rang gi 'khor la blta bar bya'o //

analyzed: shes ldan dag sh'akya'i bu'i dge slong dag 'jig rten la bdag nyid mkhas par bgrangs par byed na 'di ltar dgon par gding ba dor bar bya ba de yang mi shes so zhes zer ba'i skabs de dge slong rnams @34b gyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.

original: / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: dgon par yang rtsva'i gding ba dor bar bya'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis dgon par yag rtsva'i gding ba dor bar bya'o //

original: zhes bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: zhes bka' stsal nas /
translated: “The Blessed One has said that you should discard a mat of grass in the wilderness, too.”

original: dge slong rab tu mang po dag don mthun dang lhan cig ljongs rgyu zhing 'dong ba na /
analyzed: dge slong rab tu mang po dag don mthun dang lhan cig ljongs rgyu zhing 'dong ba na /

original: dgon pa'i gnas shig tu zhag pa dang / don mthun de nam ma nangs pa nyid du 'phags nas /
analyzed: dgon pa'i gnas shig tu zhag pa dang / don mthun de nam ma nangs pa nyid du 'phags nas /
translated: They stayed overnight in a monastery, and before dawn the caravan set out.

original: dge slong de dag ji srid du gding ba 'dor bar byed pa de srid du don mthun thal nas de dag phyi bzhin 'brang zhing 'dong ba na chom rkun pa dag gis bcom mo //
analyzed: dge slong de dag ji srid du gding ba 'dor bar byed pa de srid du don mthun thal nas de dag phyi bzhin 'brang zhing 'dong ba na chom rkun pa dag gis bcom mo //

original: de dag mthar gyis rgyu zhing 'dong ba na mnyan yod du phyin nas dge slong rnams kyis de dag mthong nas smras pa /🔽tshe dang ldan pa dag 'ongs pa legs so //

original: 'ongs pa legs so //
analyzed: 'ongs pa legs so //
translated: Welcome, Venerables!

original: ji lta bde bar brgyus sam /
analyzed: ji lta bde bar brgyus sam /

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag ji ltar bde bar brgyus /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag ji ltar bde bar brgyus /

original: kho bo cag chom rkun pa dag gis bcom mo //
analyzed: kho bo cag chom rkun pa dag gis bcom mo //
translated: We were robbed by thieves.”

original: gang gis ji ltar gyur /
analyzed: gang gis ji ltar gyur /
translated: “What happened?”

original: de dag gis skabs de dge slong rnams la brjod nas dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de dag gis skabs de dge slong rnams la brjod nas dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: dge slong dag tshon rtsva'i las byed pa na / dang ra dag tu rtsva dag bkram ste / gos dag skems par byed cing de dag rtsva de dag 'dor @35a *//

original: bar mi byed nas /
analyzed: bar mi byed nas /

original: der sril dag byung bar gyur nas /
analyzed: der sril dag byung bar gyur nas /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rtsva dag dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: rtsva dag dor bar bya'o //
translated: “You should throw the grass away.”

original: dge slong gzhan dag tshon rtsi'i las byed par 'dod nas /
analyzed: dge slong gzhan dag tshon rtsi'i las byed par 'dod nas /

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag rtsva 'di dag ma dor cig dang kho bo cag gis kyang 'dir gos dag bskam par bya'o //

analyzed: de dag gis de dag la mi ster nas /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin par bya'o //

original: de dag gis de dang de dag tu gos dag bskams nas /
analyzed: de dag gis de dang de dag tu gos dag bskams nas /

original: kho bo cag gis ma bting ngo zhes rtsva de dag 'dor bar mi byed nas /
analyzed: kho bo cag gis ma bting ngo zhes rtsva de dag 'dor bar mi byed nas /
translated: “We didn’t lay them out,” they said, and they didn’t remove the grass.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: de dag la rtsva 'dor ram mi 'dor zhes dri bar bya zhing /
analyzed: de dag la rtsva 'dor ram mi 'dor zhes dri bar bya zhing /
translated: “You should ask them, ‘Do you remove the grass or not?’

analyzed: gal te 'dor ro zhes zer na sbyin par bya'o //

original: gal te mi 'dor ro zhes zer na sbyin par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gal te mi 'dor ro zhes zer na sbyin par mi bya'o //
translated: If they say, ‘We don’t remove it,’ you should not give it to them.”

original: dge slong dag 'chag sa dag tu 'chag pa na de nas rtsub pas de dag gi rkang mthil tsha nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'chag sa dag tu 'chag pa na de nas rtsub pas de dag gi rkang mthil tsha nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: When the monks were walking on the paths, the rough ground burned their feet. The Blessed One said,

original: der rtsa dag gding bar bya'o //
analyzed: der rtsa dag gding bar bya'o //
translated: “You should lay out grass there.”

original: rtsva dag bting ba dang / der sril dag byung nas /
analyzed: rtsva dag bting ba dang / der sril dag byung nas /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: dor bar bya'o //
translated: “You should remove them.”

original: de dag nyi ma re re zhing 'dor bar byed nas /
analyzed: de dag nyi ma re re zhing 'dor bar byed nas /
translated: They removed them every day.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

analyzed: nyi ma re re zhing dor bar mi bya bar 'di ltar dus dang dus su so sor brtag par bya'o //
translated: “You should not remove them every day. You should inspect them from time to time.”

original: gal te thams cad kyi thams cad du 'dong ba na /
analyzed: gal te thams cad kyi thams cad du 'dong ba na /
translated: If they are going everywhere,

original: de'i tshe bsdus @35b te 'dong bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe bsdus @35b te 'dong bar bya'o //

original: dge slong dag 'chag sa dag tu rtsva'i chun po dag sa la 'jog par byed pa na der sril dag byung nas /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'chag sa dag tu rtsva'i chun po dag sa la 'jog par byed pa na der sril dag byung nas /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: thag pas bcings nas shing ljon pa dag la dpyangs te gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: thag pas bcings nas shing ljon pa dag la dpyangs te gzhag par bya'o //
translated: “Tie them with rope and hang them from trees.”

original: dge slong dag lci ba dag sa la 'jog par byed pa na de dag tu sril dag byung nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong dag lci ba dag sa la 'jog par byed pa na de dag tu sril dag byung nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Monks put their excrement on the ground, and snakes came out. The Blessed One said,

original: gyo mor gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: gyo mor gzhag par bya'o //
translated: “Put it in a pit.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa 'dod pa dang / bslab pa gus pa dang / bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa 'dod pa dang / bslab pa gus pa dang / bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One, having praised those who desire training, those who respect training, and those who are ascetic with regard to training,

analyzed: dge slong rnams la de dang mthun pa dang / de'i shad che ba dang / de dang 'brel ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid mdzad nas /
translated: spoke in a way that accords with Dharma, in a way that is appropriate, in a way that is connected, to the monks.

original: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha said to the monks,

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na snga ma ni bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na snga ma ni bcas pa yin la /
translated: “Monks, therefore, the previous practice is now prohibited.

original: 'di ni gnang ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni gnang ba yin te /
translated: This is now permitted.

original: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /🔽yang dge slong gang dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang du rtsva'i gding ba'am /
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste / yang dge slong gang dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang du rtsva'i gding ba'am /
translated: My disciples should recite this training rule like this:

analyzed: lo ma'i gding ba bting ngam / 'ding du bcug nas ma bsdus sam / sdud du ma bcug gam /
translated: ‘If a monk spreads out or has someone spread out a grass mat or a leaf mat in a dwelling of the Sangha,

original: dge slong 'khod pa la ma bcol bar de nas song na /
analyzed: dge slong 'khod pa la ma bcol bar de nas song na /
translated: and he then leaves without putting it away or having it put away or informing a monk who is staying there,

original: de 'dra ba'i rkyen ma gtogs te ltung byed do //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i rkyen ma gtogs te ltung byed do //
translated: except if there are special circumstances, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

original: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //
translated: A monk: a monastic of this kind.

original: dge 'dun gyi zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi'o //
translated: Of the Sangha: of the Sangha of the Buddha’s disciples.

original: gtsug lag khang du zhes bya @36a *//
analyzed: gtsug lag khang du zhes bya @36a *//
translated: In a dwelling:

original: ba ni gang du spyod lam bzhi po 'gro ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal bar byar rung bar ro //🔽rtsva'i gding ba zhes bya ba ni rtsva dag go /
analyzed: ba ni gang du spyod lam bzhi po 'gro ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal bar byar rung bar ro // rtsva'i gding ba zhes bya ba ni rtsva dag go /
translated: “Where” means in a place suitable for the four modes of behavior: walking, standing, sitting, and lying down.🔽“Grass mat” means grass.

original: lo ma'i gding ba zhes bya ba ni lo ma dag go /
analyzed: lo ma'i gding ba zhes bya ba ni lo ma dag go /
translated: “Leaf mat” means leaves.

original: bting ngam zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: bting ngam zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: “Spreads” means by oneself.

original: 'ding du bcug nas zhes bya ba ni gzhan no //
analyzed: 'ding du bcug nas zhes bya ba ni gzhan no //
translated: “Causes to spread” means by another.

original: ma bsdus sam zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: ma bsdus sam zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: “Does not gather up” means by oneself.

original: sdud du ma bcug gam zhes bya ba gzhan no //
analyzed: sdud du ma bcug gam zhes bya ba gzhan no //
translated: “Does not have it gathered up” means by another.

original: dge slong 'khod pa la zhes bya ba ni de na dge slong gang yod pa la'o //
analyzed: dge slong 'khod pa la zhes bya ba ni de na dge slong gang yod pa la'o //
translated: “The monks who are staying there” means those who are there.

original: ma bcol bar zhes bya ba ni ma gtad par ro //
analyzed: ma bcol bar zhes bya ba ni ma gtad par ro //
translated: “Without asking” means without informing.

original: de nas song na zhes bya ba ni nye 'khor spangs na'o //
analyzed: de nas song na zhes bya ba ni nye 'khor spangs na'o //
translated: “If he goes away” means if he leaves the vicinity.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa nye bar 'khor gyis zhus pa /🔽btsun pa gding ba'i nye 'khor gang lags /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa nye bar 'khor gyis zhus pa / btsun pa gding ba'i nye 'khor gang lags /
translated: The venerable Upāli asked the Blessed Buddha,🔽“Reverend, what is the vicinity of a mat?”

original: nye bar 'khor /
analyzed: nye bar 'khor /
translated: “Upāli,

original: ngas bram ze gro bzhin skyes la /
analyzed: ngas bram ze gro bzhin skyes la /
translated: I taught the brahman Kolita

original: aa mra'i sdong po shin tu me tog phun sum tshogs pa /
analyzed: aa mra'i sdong po shin tu me tog phun sum tshogs pa /
translated: seven mango trees, which were very well endowed with flowers,

original: 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa /
analyzed: 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa /
translated: very well endowed with fruits,🔽and very well endowed with clusters of branches, each of which was seven fathoms tall,

original: yal ga'i tshogs phun sum tshogs pa 'dom bdun gyis bar du chod pa'i aa mra'i sdong po bdun gang dag yin pa de dag la 'dom bzhi bcu rtsa dgu yod par bstan pa de ni gding ba'i nye 'khor yin no //
analyzed: yal ga'i tshogs phun sum tshogs pa 'dom bdun gyis bar du chod pa'i aa mra'i sdong po bdun gang dag yin pa de dag la 'dom bzhi bcu rtsa dgu yod par bstan pa de ni gding ba'i nye 'khor yin no //
translated: and the space between them was seven fathoms.🔽Except in special circumstances

original: de 'dra ba'i rkyen ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni de 'dra ba'i rkyen bzhag ste'o //🔽ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags ngan song dang / ngan 'gro dang / log par ltung @36b ba dag tu sreg par byed /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i rkyen ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni de 'dra ba'i rkyen bzhag ste'o // ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags ngan song dang / ngan 'gro dang / log par ltung @36b ba dag tu sreg par byed /
translated: means except in special circumstances.🔽One commits a downfall means one is burned,🔽cooked, and falls into the hells, the animal realm,

original: 'tshod par byed /
analyzed: 'tshod par byed /
translated: the world of the hungry ghosts, the lower realms,

original: ltung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ltung bar byed pa'o //
translated: and bad rebirths.

original: gzhan yang ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na /
translated: Moreover, as long as one does not confess and reveal that downfall,

original: dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: It obscures virtuous qualities. Therefore, it is called a downfall.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one commit this downfall?

original: dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang du rtsva'i gding ba'am lo ma'i gding ba gting ngam /🔽'ding du bcug nas ma bsdus sam /
analyzed: dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang du rtsva'i gding ba'am lo ma'i gding ba gting ngam / 'ding du bcug nas ma bsdus sam /
translated: If a monk spreads out a grass mat or a leaf mat in the saṅgha’s temple,

original: sdud du ma bcug gam /
analyzed: sdud du ma bcug gam /
translated: or has it spread out,🔽and then leaves without putting it away,🔽or without asking another monk to put it away,

original: dge slong 'khod pa la ma bcol bar de nas song na ji srid du nye 'khor ma spangs kyi bar du nyes byas su 'gyur la /
analyzed: dge slong 'khod pa la ma bcol bar de nas song na ji srid du nye 'khor ma spangs kyi bar du nyes byas su 'gyur la /
translated: then, as long as he has not abandoned the vicinity, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: nye 'khor spangs na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //🔽gal te lam kar bdag gis dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang du rtsva'i gding ba'am /
analyzed: nye 'khor spangs na ltung byed du 'gyur ro // gal te lam kar bdag gis dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang du rtsva'i gding ba'am /
translated: If he abandons the vicinity, he commits a serious offense.🔽If, on the way, he thinks, “I spread out a grass mat or a leaf mat in the saṅgha’s temple,”

original: lo ma'i gding ba bting ngo snyam du dran zhing gal te de 'di snyam du bdag gi tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa dag sdud par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: lo ma'i gding ba bting ngo snyam du dran zhing gal te de 'di snyam du bdag gi tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa dag sdud par 'gyur ro snyam na /

original: dge slong des phyin chad de ltar mi bya'o snyam du sems bskyed par bya zhing tshig tu yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong des phyin chad de ltar mi bya'o snyam du sems bskyed par bya zhing tshig tu yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: The monk should think, “I will not do that again,” and say it.

original: ltung ba de yang chos bzhin du phyir bya'o //
analyzed: ltung ba de yang chos bzhin du phyir bya'o //
translated: And he should confess that offense in accordance with the Teaching.

original: gal te lam kar dge slong der 'gro ba mthong zhing gal te /
analyzed: gal te lam kar dge slong der 'gro ba mthong zhing gal te /
translated: If he sees that monk on the road, and🔽if he thinks, “He will collect it,” he should say to him,

original: de 'di snyam du 'dis sdud par 'gyur ro snyam na de la 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa kho bos dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang gi phyogs ga ge mo zhig tu rtsva'i gding ba'am lo ma'i gding ba bting ba de sdus shig ces brjod par bya
analyzed: de 'di snyam du 'dis sdud par 'gyur ro snyam na de la 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa kho bos dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang gi phyogs ga ge mo zhig tu rtsva'i gding ba'am lo ma'i gding ba bting ba de sdus shig ces brjod par bya
translated: “Venerable, I spread out a straw mat or a leaf mat in such-and-such a place in the saṅgha’s temple. Please collect it.”

original: zhing dge slong des phyin chad de ltar mi bya'o snyam du sems bskyed @37a *//🔽par bya zhing tshig tu yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: zhing dge slong des phyin chad de ltar mi bya'o snyam du sems bskyed @37a *// par bya zhing tshig tu yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: The monk should think, “I will not do that again,”🔽and say it.

original: ltung ba de yang chos bzhin du phyir bya'o //
analyzed: ltung ba de yang chos bzhin du phyir bya'o //
translated: And he should confess that offense in accordance with the Teaching.

original: dge slong des kyang dge slong de la khas blangs nas gus par byas te bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong des kyang dge slong de la khas blangs nas gus par byas te bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The other monk should agree to collect it and then do so respectfully.

original: gal te sdud par mi byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sdud par mi byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If he does not collect it, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: gal te der song nas bdag gis dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang du rtsva'i gding ba'am lo ma'i gding ba bting ngo snyam du dran zhing gal te de 'di snyam du /🔽bdag gi tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa dag sdud par 'gyur ro snyam na dge slong des phyin chad de ltar mi bya'o snyam du sems bskyed par bya zhing tshig tu yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te der song nas bdag gis dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang du rtsva'i gding ba'am lo ma'i gding ba bting ngo snyam du dran zhing gal te de 'di snyam du / bdag gi tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa dag sdud par 'gyur ro snyam na dge slong des phyin chad de ltar mi bya'o snyam du sems bskyed par bya zhing tshig tu yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: If he goes there and remembers that he has spread a grass mat or a leaf mat in the saṅgha’s temple, and if he thinks,🔽‘My fellow brahmacārin will collect it,’ that monk should think and say,

original: ltung ba de yang chos bzhin du phyir bya'o //
analyzed: ltung ba de yang chos bzhin du phyir bya'o //
translated: ‘I will not do that again,’ and he should make amends for that offense in accordance with the rule.🔽If he goes there and sees that monk, and if he thinks,

original: gal te der son nas dge slong der 'gro ba mthong zhing gal te 'di snyam du 'dis sdud par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: gal te der son nas dge slong der 'gro ba mthong zhing gal te 'di snyam du 'dis sdud par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: ‘He will collect it,’

original: de la 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa kho bos dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang du rtsva'i gding ba'am lo ma'i gding ba bting ba de sdus shig ces brjod par bya zhing /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa kho bos dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang du rtsva'i gding ba'am lo ma'i gding ba bting ba de sdus shig ces brjod par bya zhing /
translated: He should say, ‘Venerable, please remove the grass or leaf mat that I spread in the saṅgha’s temple.’

original: dge slong des phyin chad de lta bu mi bya'o snyam du sems bskyed par bya zhing tshig tu yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong des phyin chad de lta bu mi bya'o snyam du sems bskyed par bya zhing tshig tu yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: The monk should think, ‘I will not do such a thing again,’ and say so.

original: ltung ba de yang chos bzhin du phyir bya'o //
analyzed: ltung ba de yang chos bzhin du phyir bya'o //
translated: And he should make amends for that offense in accordance with the Teaching.

original: dge slong des kyang dge slong de la khas blangs nas gus par bya ste bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong des kyang dge slong de la khas blangs nas gus par bya ste bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The other monk should accept what the first monk says and treat him with respect.

original: gal te sdud par mi byed na 'gal chabs can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sdud par mi byed na 'gal chabs can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If he does not, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang du rtsva'i gding ba'am @37b lo ma'i gding ba bting ngam 'ding du bcug nas /
analyzed: dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang du rtsva'i gding ba'am @37b lo ma'i gding ba bting ngam 'ding du bcug nas /

original: ma bsdus sam sdud du ma bcug gam /
analyzed: ma bsdus sam sdud du ma bcug gam /
translated: and then does not put it away or have it put away,

original: dge slong 'khod pa la ma bcol bar gtsug lag khang du 'dir bdag gis sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa mnyam par gzhag go snyam pa'am /
analyzed: dge slong 'khod pa la ma bcol bar gtsug lag khang du 'dir bdag gis sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa mnyam par gzhag go snyam pa'am /
translated: If a monk enters the monastery without asking permission of the resident monks, thinking, “Here I will place in equipoise my mind that is not in equipoise,

original: sems mnyam par bzhag pa rnam par grol bar bya'o snyam pas nang du yang dag par 'jog gi phyir 'jug par byed cing /
analyzed: sems mnyam par bzhag pa rnam par grol bar bya'o snyam pas nang du yang dag par 'jog gi phyir 'jug par byed cing /
translated: or I will liberate my mind that is in equipoise,”

original: de ting nge 'dzin de las mtshan mo'i thun dang po'am thun phyed na ldang bar byed na /
analyzed: de ting nge 'dzin de las mtshan mo'i thun dang po'am thun phyed na ldang bar byed na /
translated: and if he rises from that meditative absorption in the first or second part of the night,

original: gal te phan phun du ma gyur na nyes byas su 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te phan phun du ma gyur na nyes byas su 'gyur la /
translated: then if he does not benefit the monastery, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gal te phan phun du gyur na byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te phan phun du gyur na byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If he does benefit the monastery, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang du rtsva'i gding ba'am lo ma'i gding ba bting ngam 'ding du bcug nas ma bsdus sam /
analyzed: dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang du rtsva'i gding ba'am lo ma'i gding ba bting ngam 'ding du bcug nas ma bsdus sam /
translated: If a monk spreads a grass mat or a leaf mat in the saṅgha’s monastery, or has it spread, and then does not gather it up or have it gathered up,

original: sdud du ma bcug gam /
analyzed: sdud du ma bcug gam /
translated: or does not cover it or have it covered,

original: dge slong 'khod pa la ma bcol bar gtsug lag khang du 'dir bdag gis sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa mnyam par gzhag go snyam pa'am /
analyzed: dge slong 'khod pa la ma bcol bar gtsug lag khang du 'dir bdag gis sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa mnyam par gzhag go snyam pa'am /
translated: Without asking the resident monks, he enters the monastery, thinking, “Here I will rest in equipoise if my mind is not in equipoise,

original: sems mnyam par bzhag pa rnam par grol bar bya'o snyam pas /
analyzed: sems mnyam par bzhag pa rnam par grol bar bya'o snyam pas /
translated: or I will liberate my mind if it is in equipoise.”🔽He then enters into meditative equipoise.

original: nang du yang dag 'jog gi phyir 'jug par byed cing de ting nge 'dzin de las mtshan mo'i gung thun nam /🔽thun tha ma'am skya rengs ma shar ba'am /
analyzed: nang du yang dag 'jog gi phyir 'jug par byed cing de ting nge 'dzin de las mtshan mo'i gung thun nam / thun tha ma'am skya rengs ma shar ba'am /
translated: He rises from that meditative absorption before midnight,🔽before the last watch of the night,🔽before dawn,

original: skya reng sa shar ba'am /🔽nyi ma ma shar ba'am /🔽nyi ma shar ba'am /🔽nyi ma'i brgyad cha shar ba'am /
analyzed: skya reng sa shar ba'am / nyi ma ma shar ba'am / nyi ma shar ba'am / nyi ma'i brgyad cha shar ba'am /

original: nyi ma'i bzhi cha shar ba'am /🔽phyed ma yol ba'am /
analyzed: nyi ma'i bzhi cha shar ba'am / phyed ma yol ba'am /
translated: before the sun has reached its highest point in the sky,🔽before noon,

original: phyed yol ba'am /🔽nyi ma'i bzhi cha lus pa'am /
analyzed: phyed yol ba'am / nyi ma'i bzhi cha lus pa'am /
translated: after noon,

original: nyi ma'i @38a *//
analyzed: nyi ma'i @38a *//
translated: before the sun has set four quarters,

original: brgyad cha lus pa'am /🔽nyi ma ma nub pa'am /
analyzed: brgyad cha lus pa'am / nyi ma ma nub pa'am /
translated: before the sun has set eight quarters,🔽before sunset,

original: nyi ma nub pa'am /🔽rgyu skar dag ma shar ba'am /
analyzed: nyi ma nub pa'am / rgyu skar dag ma shar ba'am /
translated: after sunset,🔽before the stars have risen,

original: rgyu skar dag shar ba na ldang bar byed na /
analyzed: rgyu skar dag shar ba na ldang bar byed na /
translated: or after the stars have risen.

original: gal te phan phun du ma gyur na nyes byas su 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te phan phun du ma gyur na nyes byas su 'gyur la /
translated: If it does not become useful, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gal te phan phun du gyur na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la /
analyzed: gal te phan phun du gyur na ltung byed du 'gyur ro // sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la /
translated: If it does become useful, there is an offense entailing confession.

original: tshe dang ldan pa nye bar 'khor gyis zhus pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa nye bar 'khor gyis zhus pa /

original: btsun pa gding ba'i phan phun du mchis /
analyzed: btsun pa gding ba'i phan phun du mchis /
translated: “Venerable One, what is the usefulness of a mat?”

original: nye bar 'khor gnyis te /
analyzed: nye bar 'khor gnyis te /
translated: “Upāli, there are two kinds:

original: rlung gi phan phun dang / sril gyi phan phun no //
analyzed: rlung gi phan phun dang / sril gyi phan phun no //
translated: the usefulness of wind and the usefulness of dust.

original: rlung gi phan phun gang zhe na /
analyzed: rlung gi phan phun gang zhe na /
translated: What is the usefulness of wind?

original: ri ma pa gcig nas rim pa gnyis pa'i bar du bzlog par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ri ma pa gcig nas rim pa gnyis pa'i bar du bzlog par gyur pa'o //
translated: It is the reversal of the mat from one layer to two layers.

original: sril gyi phan phun gang zhe na /
analyzed: sril gyi phan phun gang zhe na /
translated: What is the usefulness of dust?

original: rim pa gcig nas rim pa gnyis kyi bar du phan phun du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rim pa gcig nas rim pa gnyis kyi bar du phan phun du gyur pa'o //
translated: It is the usefulness of dust becoming two layers from one layer.

original: sa gzhi rdo ba'i gzhi can dang / bye ma'i gzhi can gang du nyes dmigs de lta bu mi 'byung ba la ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: sa gzhi rdo ba'i gzhi can dang / bye ma'i gzhi can gang du nyes dmigs de lta bu mi 'byung ba la ni ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the ground is a stone base or a sand base, and such problems do not occur.”

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the bodhisattva is insane or mentally disturbed; is suffering from an acute or chronic illness that has impaired his or her memory; or is the first offender.

original: gding ba'i ltung byed de bco lnga pa rdzogs so ////
analyzed: gding ba'i ltung byed de bco lnga pa rdzogs so ////
translated: The fifteenth chapter, on the downfall of exceeding the proper size, is concluded.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, stayed in Śrāvastī, in the Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa 'char kas dge slong gsar bu gsar bu dag la tshe dang ldan pa dag tshur sheg /
analyzed: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa 'char kas dge slong gsar bu gsar bu dag la tshe dang ldan pa dag tshur sheg /
translated: At that time, the venerable Udayana said to the young monks, “Come, Venerables, let us go to the countryside.

original: ljongs rgyur 'dong dang der bdag cag gis rgol ba dag kyang tshar @38b gcad par bya /
analyzed: ljongs rgyur 'dong dang der bdag cag gis rgol ba dag kyang tshar @38b gcad par bya /

original: rang gi grags pa yang bsgrag par bya /
analyzed: rang gi grags pa yang bsgrag par bya /

original: rnyed pa yang bsgrub par bya zhing khyed cag kyang lhung bzed dang / chos gos dang / dra ba dang / phor bu dang / ska rags dang / lung dbog pa dang / bklag pa dang / kha ton dang / rnal 'byor dang / yid la bya bas brel ba med par bya'o zhes spro bar byas pa dang /
analyzed: rnyed pa yang bsgrub par bya zhing khyed cag kyang lhung bzed dang / chos gos dang / dra ba dang / phor bu dang / ska rags dang / lung dbog pa dang / bklag pa dang / kha ton dang / rnal 'byor dang / yid la bya bas brel ba med par bya'o zhes spro bar byas pa dang /

original: de dag gis slob dpon dang mkhan po dag la zhus pa /
analyzed: de dag gis slob dpon dang mkhan po dag la zhus pa /

analyzed: mkhan po bdag cag ljongs rgyur mchi'o //

original: su dang lhan cig tu /
analyzed: su dang lhan cig tu /

original: btsun pa 'char ka dang ngo //
analyzed: btsun pa 'char ka dang ngo //
translated: Venerable Udayi.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag de ni gnas ngan len kun tu spyod pa yin pas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag de ni gnas ngan len kun tu spyod pa yin pas /

analyzed: khyed la mtho 'tsham par 'gyur ro //
translated: he will harass you.

analyzed: mkhan po btsun pa 'char ka ni bdag cag gi pha ma lta bur rnam par gnas pa lags pas /
translated: Preceptor, Venerable Udayi is like our parents, he is our support.

analyzed: ci'i skad du de bdag cag la mtho 'tsham par 'gyur zhes de dag gis de dag gi tshig tshig ma yin par byas te de dang lhan cig ljongs rgyur 'phags so //
translated: “Why would he be critical of us?” They took his words to be not words and set out on their journey with him.

analyzed: 'char kas gang gi tshe phyi rol gyi mtshams 'das pa de'i tshe na smras pa /
translated: When Udayī passed beyond the outer boundary, he said,

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag khyed cag ci'i phyir gnas ma bcas par ljongs rgyur 'dong bar byed /

original: tshur sheg / gnas chos shig ces des de dag mdun du tsog pur 'dug tu bcug ste gnas 'char bcug go /
analyzed: tshur sheg / gnas chos shig ces des de dag mdun du tsog pur 'dug tu bcug ste gnas 'char bcug go /
translated: Come, let’s assign a place to stay.” He had them sit down in front of him and assigned a place to stay.

analyzed: des de dag la la la gtur bu gtad / la la la lhung bzed kyi snod gtad / la la la bar bur snod gtad /

original: la la la phor bu gtad /
analyzed: la la la phor bu gtad /
translated: a cup to another,

original: la la la ril ba spyi blugs @39a *//
analyzed: la la la ril ba spyi blugs @39a *//
translated: and a water filter to another.

original: gtad nas / de lag pa gnyis brkyang ste /
analyzed: gtad nas / de lag pa gnyis brkyang ste /
translated: Then, with his hands extended,

analyzed: rdul zan las gzhan med par 'jig rten la mtho 'tshams zhing 'gro ba na /
translated: he went off to be critical of the world, which had nothing but dust and dirt.

analyzed: de dag ri brags shig tu phyin nas de dag der khron pa zhig gi drung du ngal so bar byed pa na /

analyzed: de na ri brags kyi gtsug lag khang zhig yod pa der gand'i brdungs pa dang / de dag gis thos nas smras pa /

analyzed: slob dpon rnyed pa'i gand'i ma lags sam /

analyzed: slob dpon ni grags pa bsod nams che ba lags pas 'thob kyi /
translated: “The preceptor is famous and has great merit, so he will get it.

original: bdag cag sus stsol bar 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag cag sus stsol bar 'gyur /

original: deng la gal te rnyed pa yod na kho bo'i yang nos shig /
analyzed: deng la gal te rnyed pa yod na kho bo'i yang nos shig /

analyzed: de dag dong ba dang ci tsam na der gnas mal gyi gand'i brdungs nas /
translated: When they went there, they saw that the monks were already settled in the beds.

original: dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag gnas mal nos shig /

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /

analyzed: bdag cag las ches rgan pa yang yod do //

analyzed: su yin / slob dpon 'char ka'o //

analyzed: de'i yang nos shig /

analyzed: de dag gis gnas mal mnos so //

analyzed: ma he 'di dag su'i zhes 'du 'dzi'i gtam gyis 'dug go /

analyzed: rkang pa'i chu dang rkang pa bsku ba mtha' gcig tu bzhag ste /
translated: “Where is he?”🔽“He is sleeping in the temple.”🔽“Where is he?”🔽“He is sleeping in the temple.”🔽“Where is he?”

analyzed: rkang pa gnyis bkrus nas me khang du zhugs te nyal lo // tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka yang ji srid du de'i 'du 'dzi'i gtam gyi zla yod pa de srid du 'dug 'dug nas /
translated: “He is sleeping in the temple.”🔽“Where is he?”🔽“He is sleeping in the temple.”🔽“Where is he?”🔽“He is sleeping in the temple.”
